intro: Cola octoloboides, commonly known as the African cola tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain seeds, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Cola octoloboides thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is typically found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and valuable component of its native ecosystems.
